Note:  The box itself acts as a testing kit, as well as containing 14 objects to be used in the drafting round.  Players can also customize with addition of their own objects.

—description from the publisher

Name: Insect Intersection
Description:
You are an insect, determined to out-survive your rivals and avoid your predators! Targeted for ages 8+, this game simulates actual mechanisms of natural selection.  Will you try to fight off every predator, hide yourself away from danger, or escape to a safer location?

Each round, a new threat will apply pressure to your populations. The insects with the best adaptations to deal with the threat survive and breed. Some of those who were unprepared are consumed, but the survivors adapt new traits to help them deal with future threats.

The winner is the player whose insect population reaches 10 first OR the is the last one standing!

—description from the publisher

Name: Warfare in the Age of Reason (Third Edition)
Description:
Warfare in the Age of Reason (Third edition)

A Century of Global Conflict.
Includes complete, tactical, campaign and siege rules.

Army list from Marlborough to George Washington encompassing the wars in Europe, North America, India and Scotland. 
Two campaigns included: one for up to 8 players and one for 2 players.
3 scenarios:

     Lobositz 1756
     Eutaw Spring 1781
     Spreyerbach 1703


Changes from the 2nd edition include:

     Greatly expanded army list with extensive historical notes
     Many optional rules plus clarifications. 
     Same basic system as the 2nd edition with some streamlined mechanics
     Expansions for the multiplayer Sport of Kings campaign system
     Introducing "Enlightened Slaughter" a 2 player campaign system with the first module: "the Habsburg Empire Strikes Back" , Silesia 1758.


- Description from back of book
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Neuro Hero
Description:
You are a team of doctors trying to get a neuron to fire.  Will you be the first doctor to make the neuron reach its critical threshold and fire a signal?  Will you be a… neuro hero?

Positive and negative cards are arranged in a tree, feeding signals to a neuron.  Players take turns flipping over cards, trying to be the first player to reach or cross the threshold of 15 points.  Along the way they have the option to use one of five "neuromodulators" which give special abilities.

A fun way to learn about neuroscience or just enjoy your critical thinking skills!

—description from the designer

Name: Mealtime Madness
Description:
A quick, two-player Print-and-Play game where both players collect and steal food-based cards to try and achieve the higher end score each round. Certain foods even give bonuses when combined with others, so make yourself a tasty combo!

—description from the designer

Name: SabreSquadron: Rules for Company-Level Miniatures Games from the Cold War to the Digital Age
Description:
Sabresquadron is a set of rules for company-level wargaming from the Cold War to the Digital Age.

The rules are fast-moving and easy to pick up, and cover all the important factors including helicopters, guided missiles, the latest armours, engineering, drones and electronic warfare, through a set of robust and consistent mechanisms.

In a period that is awash with technology Sabresquadron represents the major elements but emphasises troop quality and the importance of the right tactics - the successful commander will use technology but not be a slave to it.

Although this is a mechanized era we don't forget the infantry so one can go to Goose Green with 2 Para as well as to 73 Easting with 2ACR, and there are specific rules for urban combat.

- Publisher blurb

Name: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid – Zeo Gold Character Pack
Description:
Go Gold Ranger!

The legendary Zeo Gold Ranger joins the game, complete with his epic Carrierzord, Pyramidas, and a special set of black-and-gold dice. Play as either Trey of Triforia or the veteran Jason Lee Scott as you take the battle to a whole new level!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Power Rangers: Heroes of the Grid
Series: Power Rangers Heroes of the Grid Phase 2

Name: Bratzy
Description: This dice game is similar to Yahtzee using metallic-coloured dice.

Name: Козацький похід
Description:
ÐšÐ¾Ð·Ð°Ñ†ÑŒÐºÐ¸Ð¹ Ð¿Ð¾Ñ…Ñ–Ð´ ("Cossack Campaign") is an atmospheric historical game with which you will plunge into the times of the glorious cossacks.

This board game successfully combines strategic actions on the playing field and card mechanics, which reproduces political intrigues that Cossack leaders weave. The political and military center of Ukraine is the Zaporizhzhya Sich, with its well-established laws and democracy. Several prominent personalities, real leaders and cossacks, are simultaneously trying to lead the state to success, but each of them sees his own way.

Cards of hetman for the boardgame cossack campaign

Players must play the role of atamans and hetman, leading the Cossack campaign of the famous Zaporozhye army, and conduct a successful military-political campaign to defeat rivals and prove that they are worthy of the hetman's mace. Wins the one who successfully fulfill their strategic and tactical tasks, giving hetman orders to atamans, and receive the greatest number of achievements in the Cossack campaigns.

The goal of the game is to score as many points as possible:

After completing the task from the card of hetman;

Capturing cities and settlements on the map during campaigns;

After completing the task from the additional task cards;

Using all your trekking chips.

Players strive to complete their tasks and capture as many cities and settlements as possible. But power belongs to the one who holds the hetman's mace, and he has the right to give orders only and lead the Cossack campaigns. Therefore, after receiving the coveted mace and hetmanship, the player uses card orders to send the formidable Zaporozhye army on campaigns and raids, to capture cities and settlements under his flag. Getman punishes the recalcitrant and generously encourages the obedient.

Name: Marvel Spider-Sense Spider-Man Action Game
Description:
The goal of the Action Game is to get rid of all cards as quickly as possible. Deal 5 cards to each player, and put the rest in a face-down stack. A starting card from the top of the face-down stack is turned face-up on the table. Each player takes turns playing a card on top of the face-up stack, which must match either the symbol, color, or number of the current top card in that stack. If you don't have a matching card, you have to draw from the face-down stack. There are action cards which trigger changes in the game when played. Minimum number of players is 2.

It also comes with a second set of rules for the same 32 cards, called Happy Families or Quartets. The goal of this game is to collect as many families as possible (groups of 4 cards that belong together). With 2 players, deal 10 cards to each player, and place the remaining 12 cards in a face-down stack. One player begins by asking for a certain card; they must already have at least one card from that family. If the opponent does not have that card, then the player picks up the top card from the stack, and then it is the other player's turn. Or with 3 or more players, deal out all the cards equally among the players; and a player can continue asking for cards from selected opponents until they make a mistake (asking for a card that the person asked doesn't have). Whoever collects the most sets of 4 wins.

--user summary

Name: I'm Gunna Make Mince Meat Outa you!: Rules for Bar Brawling in the Old West
Description: I'm Gunna Make Mince Meat Outa you! is a rule set for bar brawling in the setting of the old west. It uses a unique activation system to simulate the havoc and inconsistency of attitudes in the bar.
